message: Er... Leslie i don't think you're right. Before you keel over with anger. 1. If a man wore that his balls would hang out - that was where I was going. Just because her vagina doesn't fall out, I still find it indecent. It's an inappropriate garment full stop. It's not a matter of masculine / feminine for me - it's just plain inappropriate. 2. I've no problem with men wearing skirts or make up in public and I know no one who would. I have no issue with fluid gender - my experience across the U.K. is that if you're a nice person, no one cares. (Maybe different in schools!?). Maybe we're more liberal than you guys in the USA. That said if men chose to wear skirts etc, they - like women - have to be a socially acceptable length. That's to say his balls and arse aren't to hanging out. That IS important here. You may call it old fashioned, I call it common decency. 3. Mulan, Disney film for kids. She is referred to as a 'cross dresser'. So no, it's not only applied to men. So I think your anger is a bit misplaced and you've turned a gender less comment on appropriateness of attire into a wider debate on gender....

I'm a Trump supporter , & I wouldn't even do that to someone. I get that he didn't have to help her BUT he's a tow guy , isn't it his job to help someone?

Messing with the an ecosystem that has taken hundreds of thousands of years to develop = DISASTER!!! drastic change makes for drastic knock on effects. In 1945 Australia introduced the cane toad to help control the cane beetle and stop them eating the sugar canes. 70 years on they are still spreading across the country poisoning predators and out eating the native frogs insect base. This was over looked at the time of introduction....perhaps there might be something we are over looking here.
